channel.title: Belgian Network Research Meeting
channel.description: Recent content on Belgian Network Research Meeting

item.title: Home
item.description: BeNet – What? The 7th edition of the Belgian Network Research Meeting (BeNet) will be held at the University of Ghent (UGent) on December 6th, 2017. This annual meeting is a place for the Belgium-based researchers interested in the network paradigm to meet and communicate their results, regardless of the discipline: biology, communication, economics, geography, history, informatics, mathematics, medicine, physics, sociology, statistics, etc. Previous editions were held in Louvain-La-Neuve (UCL 2016), Namur (UNamur 2015), Brussels (ULB 2014), Leuven (IIS/KUL 2013), Antwerpen (UA 2012) and Brussels (VUB 2011).

item.title: Location and Contact
item.description:
Location The BeNet 2017 meeting will be held at Ghent University, in leslokaal Paddenhoek 1.0, Aula Complex (https://soleway.ugent.be/routes/2114l). Address: Paddenhoek 1-3, 9000 Ghent.
Contacts For any question or request please contact Daniele Marinazzo or Julie Birkholz

item.title: Program
item.description: You can download the book of abstract from HERE. Program 8:30 Welcome and Registration 9:00 Econometric Models of Network Formation Bryan S. Graham Invited Speaker 10:00 Coffee Break 10:30 Compressing Over-The-Counter Markets Tarik Roukny 10:50 Network Effect on Stock Market Participation Olga Balakina, Anastasia Parakhonyak 11:10 Assessing Dynamic Changes of the US Financial Market: Insights from Network Science Yerali Gandica, Marco Geraci, Sophie Béreau, Jean-Yves Gnabo 11:30 Sovereign Wealth Funds’ Cross-border Investments: Assessing the Role of Country-level Drivers and Spatial Competition Malik Kerkour, Jean-Yves Gnabo, Nicolas Debarsy 11:50 The Belgian Production Network Glenn Magerman, Emmanuel Dhyne 12:10 Lunch + Poster session 13:10 Mixing Event 14:00 Causal Inference Using Multi-Channel Regime Switching Information Transfer Estimation Carl-Henrik Dahlqvist 14:20 Learning Graph-structured Dictionaries for Sparse Representation of Diffusive Signals on Graphs Shuyu Dong 14:40 Stochastic Model for Information Propagation in Complex Networks Dimitri Papadimitriou 15:00 Deformed Laplacians on Graphs and Networks with Applications to Ranking, Visualization and Community Detection Michael Fanuel 15:20 Coffee Break 15:50 The Impact of Business Location on University Contract Research: a Two-mode ERGM Analysis André Spithoven, Jef Vlegels, Walter Ysebaert 16:10 Emergent Features of Triadic Relations in Political Networks Jan Ryckebusch, Andres M.

item.title: Registration
item.description: Important dates Abstract submission Tue, Nov 21, 2017 (both oral and poster contributions) Notification of acceptance Sat, Nov 25, 2017 Registration Fri, Dec 1, 2017 Call for abstracts Oral and poster contribution are welcome, please refer to EasyChair for submissions. Oral contributions: short talks abstracts (20 minutes including questions) should be submitted to EasyChair in text format (no more than 300 words).
